bestBHT.bht: A man named Joseph, referred to as a councillor, is described using different terms in the Gospel accounts: rich, honorable, good, and just. These descriptions illustrate his authority, integrity, moral character, and righteousness. Joseph's goodness encompasses acts of kindness, while his justice reflects his righteous way of life. The variations in the Gospels emphasize the unique perspectives and details each author brings to the portrayal of Joseph's character.

Marvin Vincent: Councillor. See on Mark 14:43. Matt. calls him rich; Mark, honorable; Luke, good and just.
Philip Schaff: And just. In the Old Testament sense.
‘Good’ is more than ‘just’ (comp. Romans 5:7), but the former always includes the latter.
John Gill: And behold, there was a man named Joseph,....a counsellor
and he was a good man, and a just
he was kind and beneficent in his temper, and just, and righteous in his life and actions

bhtAttempts.bht: Here, a man named Joseph is described as a councillor, which means someone with authority and integrity. The different Gospel accounts use various words to describe him, such as rich, honorable, good, and just. These qualities of being good and just are significant because they highlight his moral character and righteousness. Joseph's goodness and justice extend beyond just being morally upright; they encompass acts of kindness and his righteous way of life. Additionally, the variations in how the different Gospels describe Joseph demonstrate the unique perspectives and details each author brings to the story.
